meanings.definition: To interpret (something) in an excessive or exaggerated manner.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overinterpret every text message she receives, always looking for hidden meanings.
meanings.sent2: It's easy to overinterpret a simple gesture and assume it means more than it does.
meanings.sent3: John's overinterpretation of the weather forecast led him to bring an umbrella on a sunny day.
meanings.sent4: Her tendency to overinterpret people's expressions turned her into a self-proclaimed mind reader.
meanings.sent5: The detective's overinterpretation of the suspect's alibi helped crack the case.

meanings.definition: The act of interpreting something in an excessive or exaggerated manner.
meanings.sent1: Overinterpretation of dreams can sometimes lead to unnecessary anxiety.
meanings.sent2: The article warned against the dangers of overinterpretation in scientific studies.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit humorously portrayed the absurdity of overinterpretation in daily conversations.
meanings.sent4: In the world of art, overinterpretation can sometimes overshadow the true beauty of a piece.
meanings.sent5: The teacher emphasized the importance of avoiding overinterpretation when analyzing literature.
